trans-unit.source: Isolates into a separate class methods that are used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control and can be overridden by developers who extend the control, but are rarely needed by page developers.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class is the largest class in the Web Parts control set.
It is also among the most important Web Parts classes because it is used on every Web page that contains Web Parts controls, and it coordinates and manages all Web Parts controls on a page.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class is used so frequently, and because it contains so many exposed methods, some methods needed mostly by control developers who are extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control are contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class.

This isolation of less-used methods into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class simplifies the API of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, and the isolated methods do not appear on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> object in IntelliSense.

Developers who use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class are likely to have scenarios where they need to inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control and customize it extensively.

For example, if you are building a Web portal application or a packaged set of Web Parts controls with custom display modes, custom zones, custom verbs, custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, and other extensions of the base Web Parts user interface (UI), in many cases (not all) you will need to override and extend some of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> members.

And although the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class is sealed so you cannot inherit from it, your custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class will likely need to call a number of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> methods in order to manage Web Parts controls on a page.

Like the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class provides a server control that has no UI and is never visible on a page.

Unlike <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class is never declared in the markup of a page; it is strictly a worker object that performs background tasks.

The typical way of using it is demonstrated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, which references it by means of the protected <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.Internals%2A> property, and uses the referenced object to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> methods.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class contains only methods; there are no properties or events.
All the methods in the class involve managing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, or connections between controls.

To handle <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> includes methods for adding them (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.AddWebPart%2A>), removing them <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.RemoveWebPart%2A>), handling events <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.CallOnDeleting%2A>), getting or setting details about their relationship to their zone (for example, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.GetZoneID%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetZoneIndex%2A>), or setting basic <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control properties (for example, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsClosed%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetHasSharedData%2A>).

To handle connections, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> includes methods for deleting them (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.DeleteConnection%2A>), setting which transformer object to use (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetTransformer%2A>), setting whether a connection is shared and whether it is static (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection%2CSystem.Boolean%29> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection%2CSystem.Boolean%29>), and setting a connection error message to use (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetConnectErrorMessage%2A>).

Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or server control to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control's collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> controls on a Web page.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> being added to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control's collection of controls.
Calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.OnClosing(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method of the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> that has been selected for closing.
Calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.OnConnectModeChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method of the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> that has entered or exited the connect display mode.
Calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.OnDeleting(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method of the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> that has been selected for deletion.
Calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.OnEditModeChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method of the specified control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> that has entered or exited edit display mode.
Indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object has been deleted.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> that has been selected for deletion.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the connection has been deleted.
Creates an object based on the parameter passed to the method.

The method uses the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGenerator> class to create the type, an alternative that offers better performance than using the <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the object to create.
An of the same type as type.
Sets a property to indicate that the specified connection object has been deleted.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.DeleteConnection%2A> method is one step in the process of terminating an existing connection between two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> or other server controls on a Web page.
It sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.ConnectionDeleted%2A> property value to `true` to indicate that `connection` is deleted.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> that has been selected for deletion.
Gets the ID of a zone that contains the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or server control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.GetZoneID%2A> method returns the ID of the zone that contains the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Zone%2A> property of `webPart` references the actual zone object that contains `webPart`, not the ID of the zone.

If `webPart` is currently closed, the value of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Zone%2A> property is `null`, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.GetZoneID%2A> method will return the ID of the last zone that `webPart` was in prior to being closed.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> that resides in a zone.
A string that represents the ID of the zone that contains webPart.
Loads previously saved state data for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer"></xref> object that participates in a connection between controls.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer"></xref> that is used to connect controls.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the previously saved state data.

Removes a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or other server control from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control's collection of controls.
Removes `webPart` from the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control's collection of Web Parts controls that it maintains for the page.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or other server control to be removed.
Saves state data for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer"></xref> object that participates in a connection between controls.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SaveConfigurationState%2A> method saves configuration data that is created when a user configures a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> control on a Web page as part of a connection between controls.

This configuration data is then reloaded each time the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> control is rendered, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.LoadConfigurationState%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer"></xref> that is used to connect controls.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved state data.

Establishes an errors message, and causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartChrome"></xref> object that is responsible for rendering a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control to render that message rather than the contents of the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetConnectErrorMessage%2A> method allows you to associate an error message with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control that participates in connections.

If an error occurs when another control is forming a connection with the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter, then after the connection process has failed, the error message is displayed in the user interface (UI), rather than the contents of `webPart`.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartChrome> object associated with `webPart` renders the error message in its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartChrome.RenderPartContents%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> that participates in a connection with another control.
A string that contains the text of the error message.
Sets a property on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or other server control indicating whether the control has shared personalization data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetHasSharedData%2A> method indicates whether `webPart` has shared personalization data.
The value of the `hasSharedData` parameter that is passed into the method is assigned to the `webPart` control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.HasSharedData%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or other server control that can have shared personalization data.
A Boolean value that indicates whether webPart has shared data.
Sets a property on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or other server control indicating whether the control has user personalization data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetHasUserData%2A> method indicates whether `webPart` has individual user personalization data, as opposed to shared data.
The method assigns the value of the `hasUserData` parameter to the `webPart` control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.HasUserData%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or other server control that can have user personalization data.
A Boolean value that indicates whether webPart has shared data.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsClosed"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsClosed%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsClosed%2A> property of `webPart`.
This method does not actually close `webPart`; it only sets the property that indicates whether `webPart` is closed.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> for which this method sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsClosed"></xref> property.
A Boolean value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> is closed on a page.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsShared"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%2A> method does not actually cause the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter to be shared; it only sets the property that indicates whether `webPart` is currently shared.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> for which this method sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsShared"></xref> property.
A Boolean value that indicates whether webPart is shared.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.IsShared"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%2A> method does not actually cause the control referenced by the `connection` parameter to be shared; it only sets the property that indicates whether `connection` is currently shared.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> between two <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> controls.
A Boolean value that indicates whether connection is shared.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStandalone"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStandalone%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStandalone%2A> property.

When this property is set to `true` on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control, it means that the control is not contained within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zone.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> for which this method sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStandalone"></xref> property.
A Boolean value that indicates whether webPart is a standalone control.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStatic"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method is used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStatic%2A> property value of the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter.
If `webPart` is declared within a zone in the markup of a Web page, this method sets the property value to `true`.
If `webPart` is added to a page programmatically, or by a user through the Web Parts user interface (UI), then this method sets the property value to `false`.
The control for which the property value is being set.
A Boolean value that indicates whether webPart is static.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.IsStatic"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method is used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.IsStatic%2A> property value of the connection referenced by the `connection` parameter.
If `connection` is declared in the markup of a Web page, this method sets the property value to `true`.
If `connection` is added to a page programmatically, or by a user through the Web Parts user interface (UI), then this method sets the property value to `false`.
The connection for which the property value is being set.
A Boolean value that indicates whether connection is static.
Assigns a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer"></xref> object to be used in a connection between two server controls.

When a connection between two server controls requires a transformer so that the consumer control can interpret data from the provider control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetTransformer%2A> method is called to supply a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object.

If the connection already has a transformer assigned to it, the object referenced by the `transformer` parameter overrides the existing one; otherwise, the object referenced in the `transformer` parameter is used.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetTransformer%2A> method whenever you call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.ConnectWebParts%2A> method to establish a connection that requires a transformer.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection"></xref> that creates a connection between server controls.
A to be used with connection.
Sets a property that enables a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or server control to keep the ID of the containing zone.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control is being added to a zone.
Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control tracks the ID for the zone it belongs to, and this method sets the property that keeps the ID value.
The whose zoneID property value is being set.
A string that contains the ID of the zone that webPart belongs to.
Sets the index of the specified control within its zone relative to the other <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> controls within the zone.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetZoneIndex%2A> method determines the ordinal position that `webPart` occupies in its zone, relative to other server controls in the zone.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> control for which the method sets a zone index.
The index of webPart within its zone relative to other controls in the zone.
